main.name: Connor Carson
main.description: with a passion for thrill seeking, storytelling, and TTRPGs on the side
main.bio: A recent IT Innovation graduate from the University of Nebraska at Omaha, I love to work with ReactJs, Angular, and UX/UI design whenever possible. I am currently seeking work involving website and web app projects. The most satisfying part of the project experience is creating a useful and worthwhile product for the user. I enjoy connecting with clients and working towards a solution as a team, collaborating with others to fulfill our goals and deadlines.
main.contactmessage: FORM SUBMISSIONS ARE CURRENTLY DOWN. Please feel free to reach me at the phone or email listed below!

education.degree: Bachelors of Science in IT Innovation
education.description: I started my higher learning at UNO, where I first concentrated in Computer Science and Game Design before transitioning over to IT Innovation. There I learned a diverse array of technical and programming skills, such as Java, HTML/CSS/JavaScript, C, project management, client relations, and UX/UI design.
education.description2: Getting my bachelors here provided me with a perspective that I had never known growing up in Nebraska. The idea that anything was possible finally seemed real. I found my love for problem-solving, strong teamwork, and exciting new ideas here. This experience pushes me to do more and be more than I was yesterday and I can't be more grateful.

work.title: Junior Software Developer
work.description: My work as a junior software developer at Fiserv entailed alot of maintenance of old Java thick-client applications while help my team transisiton the old software over to new web applications. I triaged critical bugs in old code and worked with clients to make sure the version in production was functioning as intended. I often built pieces of new features that the clients thought the new web apps would need.
work.description2: Working for the company, I saw the nitty gritty of what working for a development team entailed. There were tough projects and there were fun projects too. I really appreciated the help that my fellow developers provided me and how much they wanted to see me grow.

work.title: IT Technician
work.description: I began work at the CAB Lab as a way to keep working through a tough semester of classes but the experience was a valuable teaching moment. I enjoyed the work of helping the lab in any way that I could, whether it was building PCs, learning human experimentation research, or maintaining operating systems for the research computers.
work.description2: The job was a great opportunity to learn about responsibility, my work grow my abilities as a leader. I was often the go-to man for any IT-related questions and this meant that I would often have to learn about technology and problems that my classes and previous experience did not teach.

work.title: OSS Information Technology Member
work.description: My first tech experience, Union Pacific first exposed to a professional business environment. The inter-personal skills I gained were invaluable and helped me become a more out-going and confident worker. There was often a lot of system support work for my team, where we reconfigured company smartphones, retrieved data files for other departments, and help organize IT projects that would save the company money in the future.
work.description2: Supporting other employees and assisting my department helped me understand the realities of working for a corporate business and what it meant to work in a team. I also made many friends while on the job and learned the value of networking withing the tech industry.
